bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. George Repetti, December 29, 1947

div1.p: Hench inquires if Repetti's husband, George, was related to John Repetti, an Army surgeon at Columbia Barracks Post Hospital in 1900.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Mrs. George Repetti, December 29, 1947
div1.opener:
December 29, 1947
Mrs. George Repetti
5 Lake Avenue
Broadmoor, Colorado
My dear Thelma:
div1.p:
I have for some years been interested
in the story of Walter Reed and the “Conquest of
Yellow Fever.” One of the medical officers in
Cuba at that time at the hospital where the work
was done was Dr. John J. Repetti, Contract Surgeon
who lived in Washington before the Spanish-American
War and returned to Washington, D. C., and practiced medicine
there. Did George have any relatives who were
American medical officers in Cuba in 1900? I have
often wondered about the similarity in names.

I am sending you a reprint of this affair.
Doctor Repetti was one of the officers stationed at
that time at the Columbia Barracks Post Hospital.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
